[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Aggregation consistency] When PVSS transcripts are aggregated, do all resulting dealt public keys properly combine through group operations, or could attackers craft transcripts with dealt keys that don't aggregate correctly, breaking threshold reconstruction? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: as_group_element()] [Unsafe group operations] Could external code using as_group_element() perform invalid group operations (e.g., division, inversion of identity) that corrupt the dealt public key and break PVSS security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Transcript verification bypass] Since DealtPubKey doesn't contain any proof or signature, can an attacker substitute arbitrary dealt public keys in transcripts without detection, allowing them to control the final DKG output? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Multi-transcript consistency] When comparing dealt public keys from multiple transcripts (main vs fast PVSS), does the Eq implementation correctly identify inconsistent dealt keys that indicate transcript manipulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: new()] [Malicious dealer] Can a Byzantine dealer create a DealtPubKey that appears valid but was generated using a backdoored secret that they can later recover, compromising the DKG's security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Array size validation] Does to_compressed() guarantee to always return exactly DEALT_PK_NUM_BYTES, or could mismatches between the constant and actual return size cause memory corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: try_from(&[u8])] [Slice bounds] Could the slice casting in try_from cause out-of-bounds reads if the bytes slice is part of a larger buffer with arbitrary data following it? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Drop implementation] Is there a proper Drop implementation to securely zero out the group element in memory when DealtPubKey is deallocated, or could dealt key material remain in memory? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Macro: dealt_pub_key_impl!] [Code duplication] Does the macro create multiple copies of the same code for different group types, potentially causing code bloat that could be exploited for cache timing attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: try_from(&[u8])] [Error context] Does CryptoMaterialError provide sufficient context to distinguish between different failure modes (wrong length, invalid encoding, wrong subgroup), or could error ambiguity hide attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: try_from(&[u8])] [Panic safety] Could any code path in g2_proj_from_bytes or the slice conversion panic instead of returning an error, causing validator crashes when processing malicious transcripts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Trait: ValidCryptoMaterial] [to_bytes() infallibility] Since ValidCryptoMaterial::to_bytes() returns Vec<u8> without Result, could this hide serialization failures that should be errors, leading to silent data corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Thread safety] Is GTProjective thread-safe for concurrent reads via as_group_element(), or could multiple threads accessing the same DealtPubKey cause data races? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Send/Sync bounds] Does DealtPubKey properly implement Send and Sync traits, and could incorrect bounds allow unsafe concurrent access to group elements across validator threads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: try_from(&[u8])] [Compressed point variants] Does from_compressed handle all valid compressed point encodings (including compressed infinity and sign bit variations), or could certain valid representations be rejected, causing transcript incompatibility? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: try_from(&[u8])] [Malleability] Can the same mathematical point be represented by multiple different byte sequences that all pass validation, allowing attackers to create transcript malleability exploits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: try_from(&[u8])] [Fuzzing coverage] Has g2_proj_from_bytes been thoroughly fuzzed with random/malicious byte inputs, or could there be undiscovered parser bugs that crash validators or accept invalid points? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: try_from(&[u8])] [UTF-8/encoding attacks] Could providing bytes that coincidentally form valid UTF-8 or other text encodings cause issues in logging/serialization systems that process dealt public keys? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Pairing compatibility] Is the dealt public key in G2 compatible with the pairing operations used in PVSS verification equations, or could group mismatches cause verification failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Generator relationship] Does the implementation enforce that g_a is computed using the standard BLS12-381 G2 generator, or could attackers use alternate generators to break DKG security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Discrete log hardness] Does the security of dealt public keys rely on discrete log hardness in G2, and could advances in discrete log algorithms (e.g., number field sieve improvements) weaken DKG security? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: new()] [Proof of possession] Is there any proof-of-possession or knowledge proof required when creating a DealtPubKey, or can attackers create dealt keys without knowing the corresponding secret? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Rogue key attack] Could a malicious validator craft a dealt public key as a linear combination of honest validators' keys, enabling a rogue key attack that breaks threshold assumptions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Endianness] Does to_compressed() use consistent endianness across all platforms and validator implementations, or could big-endian vs little-endian differences cause transcript incompatibility? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Version compatibility] If the blstrs library changes its compressed format in future versions, could old and new validators compute different byte representations for the same dealt public key? (High)
